“Communications” Under 18 U.S.C. § 207, 25 Op. O.L.C. at 63 (observing that under section
207(c), “former officials can sell their expertise to interested clients, and their
clients can present all substantive information or views they wish to federal
agencies”). In addition, as described above, the retired officer himself may seek
generally available factual information from any military officer or department. And, because the Navy is separate from the Department of Defense for purpose of 164 Application of 18 U.S.C. § 207(c) to Communications Regarding Security Issues the federal ethics laws, see 5 C.F.R. § 2641, app. B, the retired officer may always
contact and attempt to influence officers and employees of military departments
other than the Department of the Navy. STEVEN G. BRADBURY
Acting Assistant Attorney General
Office of Legal Counsel 165
